## Introduction to Next.js Next.js is a powerful React framework that makes building web applications easier and more efficient. It provides features like server-side rendering, static site generation, and API routes out of the box. ### Why Choose Next.js? Next.js offers several advantages over traditional React applications: - **Performance**: Pre-rendering pages for faster load times - **SEO**: Better search engine optimization with server-side rendering - **Developer Experience**: Hot reloading, automatic code splitting, and more - **Flexibility**: Choose between static generation and server-side rendering per page ## Key Features ### 1. File-based Routing Next.js uses a file-based routing system. Simply create files in the `pages` directory and they automatically become routes: ``````javascript // pages/about.js export default function About() { return

About Page

} `````` ### 2. API Routes You can create API endpoints as Node.js functions: ``````javascript // pages/api/hello.js export default function handler(req, res) { res.status(200).json({ message: 'Hello from Next.js!' }) } `````` ### 3. Image Optimization The `next/image` component automatically optimizes images: ``````javascript import Image from 'next/image' function MyComponent() { return ( ) } `````` ## Getting Started To create a new Next.js application, run: ``````bash npx create-next-app@latest my-app cd my-app npm run dev `````` Your app will be running at `http://localhost:3000`. ## Conclusion Next.js is an excellent choice for building modern web applications. Its focus on performance, developer experience, and flexibility makes it suitable for projects of all sizes. Happy coding!
